      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • getBoundVars

      public byte[][] getBoundVars(Axiom syntax) throws SetMMException
      Gets the bound variable data for a given syntax axiom. This is a list of byte[] for each variable in the constructor, in database order. The non-set variables are null, and the set variable entries are a list over the variables again.

      The byte value at this index is 1 if there are bound occurrences of the set variable in the other variable, and 2 if there are free occurrences of the set variable. If both occur (i.e. the set variable occurs both bound and free, such as in df-sb) it is set to 3, and 0 if neither occurs (which should not happen unless the set variable is not used in the definition at all).

      The value of the array at two set variables is not meaningful and can be anything, except that a variable is considered to appear free w.r.t itself (i.e. (boundVars[i][i] & 2) != 0 when it appears free in the definition.

      Parameters:
      syntax - the syntax axiom
      Returns:
      the bound variable data
      Throws:
      SetMMException - if bound variable data is not available for the syntax
